Class Animation

java.lang.Object
game.graphics.Animation
public class Animation extends Object
Manages sprite sheet animations by extracting and cycling through frames. Supports both looping and non-looping animations.

This class loads frames from a sprite sheet at initialization and updates the current frame based on elapsed time. Frames are arranged horizontally in the sprite sheet.

Usage example:

 Animation walkAnimation = new Animation(
     spriteSheet, 32, 32, 0, 0, 8, 0.1, true
 );
 // In game loop:
 walkAnimation.update(deltaTime);
 gc.drawImage(walkAnimation.getCurrentFrame(), x, y);

    private javafx.scene.image.Image[]

    Array of extracted frame images from sprite sheet
    private boolean
    loop
    Whether animation should loop back to start after last frame

  • Constructor Details

    • Animation

      public Animation(javafx.scene.image.Image spriteSheet, int frameWidth, int frameHeight, int startX, int startY, int frameCount, double frameDuration, boolean loop)
      Create animation from sprite sheet
      Parameters:
      spriteSheet - The complete sprite sheet image
      frameWidth - Width of each frame
      frameHeight - Height of each frame
      startX - Starting X position in sprite sheet
      startY - Starting Y position in sprite sheet
      frameCount - Number of frames in animation
      frameDuration - Duration of each frame in seconds
      loop - Whether animation should loop

    • getFrame

      public javafx.scene.image.Image getFrame(int index)
      Get frame image by index
      Parameters:
      index - the frame index (0-based)
      Returns:
      the frame at the specified index, or first frame if out of bounds

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Check if animation is finished (for non-looping animations)
      Returns:
      true if animation is complete and not looping
